title: English Language Familiarization Quiz - Medium Difficulty
description: Enhance your English skills with this quiz focusing on sentence construction, vocabulary, and common expressions.
instructions: Write your answer in English, focusing on correct usage and grammar.
After completing all questions, submit your answers for evaluation.

items.question: Convert the following sentence to the passive voice: 'The committee will announce the results tomorrow.'
items.suggestedAnswer: The results will be announced by the committee tomorrow.

items.question: Explain the meaning of the idiom 'to play devil's advocate'.
items.suggestedAnswer: To argue against an idea or opinion to explore the thought further, not necessarily because one disagrees.

items.question: Fill in the blank: 'Despite the heavy rain, they ___ (proceed) with the outdoor event.'
What does the phrasal verb 'to look up to someone' mean?
Choose the correct word: 'The artist's latest work is ___ (ambiguous/amphibious) and open to various interpretations.'
Rewrite the following in reported speech: 'He said, "I don't believe in ghosts."'
items.suggestedAnswer: He said that he didn't believe in ghosts.

items.question: Complete the sentence with a suitable modal verb: 'You ___ (might/could/should) see a doctor if the pain persists.'
What does the word 'pedantic' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: Excessively concerned with minor details or rules; overly scholarly.

items.question: Convert the sentence to the future continuous tense: 'They travel to Paris.'
items.suggestedAnswer: They will be traveling to Paris.
